Class Validation

  • Object
    • Validation

  • public class Validation
extends Object
    Author:
    SIMONE PAGLINO

    Validation class provides several method to validate lines read from different files with very specific informations and formats.

    • Method Detail

      • isThereCharacter

        public static boolean isThereCharacter(String str)
        Parameters:
        str - A string of any format and content.
        Returns:
        It returns true if there's at least one character inside the string passed as argument, otherwise false.

      • validatePOI

        public static boolean validatePOI(String poi)
        Parameters:
        poi - A string read from a text file that represents a PointOfInterest object.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the argument passed is a valid PointOfInterest object, otherwise false.

      • validateCommand

        public static boolean validateCommand(String comm)
        Parameters:
        comm - A string read from a text file that represents a Command object.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the argument passed is a valid command, otherwise false.

      • validateCommandPossibleScenarios

        private static boolean validateCommandPossibleScenarios(String comm,
                                                        String str_method,
                                                        String str_param)
        Parameters:
        comm - A string read from a text file that represents a Command object.
        str_method - The name of the method.
        str_param - The value of the method's paramater.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the the name of the method exists and if its arguments are valid, otherwise false.

      • validateImport

        private static boolean validateImport(String param)
        Parameters:
        param - The value of import method paramater (the name of the file to load) --- Example: eventi.txt .
        Returns:
        It returns true if the argument of "import" method is valid, otherwise false.

      • validateCreateMap

        private static boolean validateCreateMap(String param)
        Parameters:
        param - The value of create_map method paramater (the time interval composed by two timestamp) --- Example: 01012001-01022001 .
        Returns:
        It returns true if the argument of "create_map" method is valid, otherwise false.

      • validateElementsLine

        public static boolean validateElementsLine(String elem_line)
        Parameters:
        elem_line - A line read from a text file representing an Event object.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the parameter follows the correct format for a line text representing an Event object, otherwise false.

      • validateUserId

        private static boolean validateUserId(String id)
        Parameters:
        id - The user's id.
        Returns:
        It return's true if the id respects the correct format for an user's id.

      • validateCoordinates

        private static boolean validateCoordinates(String coord)
        Parameters:
        coord - A string which contain latitude and longitude separated from a comma.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the coordinates are valid, otherwise false.

      • validateEmotion

        private static boolean validateEmotion(char em)
        Parameters:
        em - A character representing an emotion.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the parameter is equal to one of the predefined characters only uppercase (A, F, S, T, N).

      • listEventPossibleScenarios

        private static boolean listEventPossibleScenarios(String el,
                                                  int counter)
        Parameters:
        el - A value contained inside a line read from eventi.txt file (or similar) --- Example: IN/OUT, LOGIN/LOGOUT, timestamp ecc.
        counter - A value from 0 to 5 to distinguish the right scenario for the current element "el" passed as argument.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the info with its counter (arguments) are valid --- just for events, otherwise false.
